clean_content:
Definition / general

* Benign, usually intraosseous, hamartomatous lesion consisting of dentin, enamel and dental pulp that occurs in the maxilla or mandible* Most common odontogenic tumor, often discovered on routine dental radiographs

Essential features

* General: asymptomatic lesion found in the first 2 decades of life* Compound: radiologically appears radiopaque and radiolucent with a radiolucent halo
    + Grossly appears like normal teeth; histologically composed of well organized dentin and enamel* Complex: radiologically appears radiopaque with a radiolucent halo; histologically shows disorganized dentin and enamel

Terminology

* Compound odontoma* Complex odontoma* Developing odontoma / ameloblastic fibro-odontoma* Peripheral odontoma* First described as dental exostosis

ICD coding

* ICD-O
  + [9280/0](https://iris.who.int/bitstream/handle/10665/96612/9789241548496_eng.pdf?sequence=1#page=88) - odontoma, NOS+ [9281/0](https://iris.who.int/bitstream/handle/10665/96612/9789241548496_eng.pdf?sequence=1#page=88) - compound odontoma+ [9282/0](https://iris.who.int/bitstream/handle/10665/96612/9789241548496_eng.pdf?sequence=1#page=88) - complex odontoma* ICD-10
    + [D16.4](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/C00-D49/D10-D36/D16-/D16.4) - benign neoplasm of the bones of the skull and face+ [D16.5](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/C00-D49/D10-D36/D16-/D16.5) - benign neoplasm of the lower jawbone+ [K09.0](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/K00-K95/K00-K14/K09-/K09.0) - developmental odontogenic cysts* ICD-11
      + [2E83.0 & XH4QJ8](https://icd.who.int/browse/2024-01/mms/en#1486607775%20%26%20173223388) - benign osteogenic tumors of bone or articular cartilage of skull or face & odontoma, NOS+ [2E83.1 & XH4QJ8](https://icd.who.int/browse/2024-01/mms/en#1037047819%20%26%20173223388) - benign osteogenic tumors of bone or articular cartilage of lower jaw & odontoma, NOS

Epidemiology

* Most diagnosed in second decade of life ([Eur J Paediatr Dent 2024;25:297](39428979))* M = F

Sites

* Anterior maxilla (most common site) and mandible ([Eur J Paediatr Dent 2024;25:297](39428979))* Posterior mandible and maxilla

Pathophysiology

* Epithelial and ectomesenchymal forming hard and soft dental tissue after an unknown stimulus activates the WNT1 / beta catenin signaling pathway, resulting in proliferation of dental tissue ([J Cutan Pathol 2020;47:720](32134132), [Braz Dent J 2023;34:110](38133085))

Etiology

* Unknown; suspected causes include genetic factors, trauma or infection ([J Indian Soc Pedod Prev Dent 2022;40:208](35859415))

Diagrams / tables

Not applicable

Clinical features

* Asymptomatic in majority of cases
  + May prevent tooth eruption of permanent teeth or have symptoms related to increased pressure ([In Vivo 2024;38:2535](39187347))* Multiple odontomas are seen with Gardner syndrome of familial adenomatous polyposis ([Pathol Oncol Res 2024;30:1611768](38807857))* Peripheral odontomas show the same features as intraosseous odontomas except they are in the soft tissue ([J Cutan Pathol 2020;47:720](32134132))

Diagnosis

* Diagnosis for compound odontomas is often made from dental radiographs and gross examination ([In Vivo 2024;38:2535](39187347))* Diagnosis for complex odontomas is made with radiographs, gross examination and histological evaluation showing mature dentin and enamel ([In Vivo 2024;38:2535](39187347))

Laboratory

Not relevant

Radiology description

* Early stages: radiolucent, due to the predominant tissue being pulp, which is less dense than normal teeth; as the mass becomes more calcified, it becomes radiopaque* Compound
    + White areas due to dentin and enamel+ Possible tooth-like appearance+ Appears radiopaque and radiolucent+ Edges are clearly distinguished by a radiolucent halo* Complex
      + Disorganized with fragments of dental tissue+ Multiple radiopaque lesions may be identified+ Also surrounded by a radiolucent halo ([In Vivo 2024;38:2535](39187347))

Prognostic factors

* Excellent prognosis with rare recurrence associated with incomplete removal ([Eur J Paediatr Dent 2024;25:297](39428979))

Case reports

* Young boy with posterior left mandibular lesion ([BMJ Case Rep 2024;17:e261375](39013627))* 4 year old boy with multiple radiopaque masses and unerupted tooth ([Eur J Paediatr Dent 2024;25:297](39428979))* 8 year old boy with over 70 denticles in left maxilla ([J Indian Soc Pedod Prev Dent 2022;40:208](35859415))* 11 year old boy with nodular lesion in anterior palate ([J Cutan Pathol 2020;47:720](32134132))* 22 year old man with increasing pressure in the left mandible ([In Vivo 2024;38:2535](39187347))

Treatment

* Enucleation with extraoral surgery is gold standard ([In Vivo 2024;38:2535](39187347))

Clinical images

No information provided

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaodontoma_nih06.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5545622/figure/f2-11mjms24032017_cr1/)

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/mandiblemaxillaodontoma_nih07.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5072101/figure/F1/)

Mass in upper left maxillary region​​

Gross description

* Compound: small rudimentary tooth-like structures that are tan-white in appearance and can have surrounding fibrous connective tissue ([Head Neck Pathol 2023;17:976](37856052), [Am J Otolaryngol 2022;43:103404](35246319))* Complex: appears white to yellow and comprised of hard unorganized dental tissue
    + Disorganized mass of dentin and enamel ([Ear Nose Throat J 2021;100:536S](31760790))

Gross images

Image from PMID: 39013627 is not free to access

Enucleated 9 denticles

Frozen section description

Not relevant

Frozen section images

No information provided

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Compound: often not submitted due to being diagnosed by imaging and gross examination
  + Consists of mature tubular dentin, pulp tissue, cementum, dental follicular tissue and enamel matrix (lost during the decalcification process) ([In Vivo 2024;38:2535](39187347))* Complex: haphazard tubular dentin surrounding islands of enamel
    + Thin layer of cementum; possible epithelial ghost cells and dental follicular tissue ([In Vivo 2024;38:2535](39187347), [Ear Nose Throat J 2021;100:536S](31760790))

Electron microscopy description

Not relevant

Electron microscopy images

No information provided

Molecular / cytogenetics description

* Beta catenin signaling activation in the WNT1 / beta catenin signaling pathway ([Braz Dent J 2023;34:110](38133085))

Molecular / cytogenetics images

No information provided

Videos

No information provided

Sample pathology report

* Mandible, excision:
  + Compound odontoma

Differential diagnosis

* [Ameloblastic fibroma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillaameloblasticfibroma.html) ([Clin Cancer Res 2014;20:5517](24993163), [J Oral Pathol Med 2018;47:315](28776760)):
  + Benign, mixed odontogenic tumor with myxoid background resembling tooth papilla and an epithelial component with cuboidal to columnar palisading cells resembling ameloblastoma* **Ameloblastic fibro-odontoma** and **fibrodentinoma** ([Head Neck Pathol 2021;15:1202](33991318), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2024;137:e125](38575451), [Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol 2022;133:e178](34753693)):
    + Mixed odontogenic lesion, morphologically similar to ameloblastic fibroma but also containing dentin and enamel elements+ Some may have *BRAF* mutations* [Odontoameloblastoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillaodontoameloblastoma.html) ([Head Neck Pathol 2024;18:6](38353787)):
      + Contains areas that resemble ameloblastomas with a myxoid background and surround eosinophilic hard tissue* [Primordial odontogenic tumor](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillaprimordial.html) ([Head Neck Pathol 2016;10:237](26156422)):
        + Very rare, cyst lined by nonkeratinizing squamous epithelium with palisading basal cells and fibrous stroma with or without odontogenic epithelium* [Osteoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/mandiblemaxillaosteoma.html):
          + Generally occurs in older patients+ Composed of mature lamellar and woven bone

Additional references

None
